title: WhatsApp says Russia tried to fully block service to push state app
byline: Russia has attempted to “fully block” Meta-owned WhatsApp in the country, a company spokesperson told Reuters on Wednesday, as it promotes home-grown platforms and seeks greater control over its internet space.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall above 50 mm likely in some areas
byline: Showers will occur at times in Central, Uva, Eastern and North-central provinces and in Hambantota district.

title: Sectoral Oversight Committee approves bill to abolish pensions for MPs
byline: The Sectoral Oversight Committee on Governance, Justice and Civil Protection has approved the Bill seeking to abolish pension benefits for Members of Parliament.

title: Dawson’s Creek star James Van Der Beek dies aged 48
byline: Actor James Van Der Beek, best known for his starring role in US teen drama Dawson’s Creek, has died aged 48 after being diagnosed with bowel cancer.

title: Monthly drug review meetings proposed to ensure continuous medicine supply in hospitals
byline: Deputy Minister of Health Dr. Hansaka Wijemuni has proposed the conduct of monthly drug review meetings in every hospital to ensure an uninterrupted supply of medicines.

title: Police identify 18-year-old as suspect in Canada mass shooting
byline: An 18-year-old has been named as the suspect in a shooting that killed eight people and injured dozens more in British Columbia, Canada.

title: Bangladesh votes in landmark election after Gen Z revolution
byline: Bangladesh heads to the polls on Thursday (Feb 12), marking a return to democracy after the 2024 ouster of long‑time premier Sheikh Hasina in a Gen Z‑driven uprising, in an election seen as pivotal for the country’s stability.

title: Sri Lanka, EU to hold Joint Commission meeting today
byline: Sri Lanka and the European Union (EU) will hold the 27th Session of the EU-Sri Lanka Joint Commission in Colombo today (12).

title: Sky to bring Disney+, Netflix, Hayu and HBO Max together under one subscription
byline: Sky has announced “world first” plans to bring together several streaming platforms as part a single TV subscription.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall above 50mm likely in some areas today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Central, Uva, Eastern and North-central provinces and in the Hambantota district today (12), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: 24 deaths by drowning so far this year – Police
byline: A total of 24 individuals have died due to drowning incidents so far this year, police stated.

title: Sri Lanka Navy earns US$ 600,000 in four months from merchant vessel security operations
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has generated nearly US$ 600,000 in foreign exchange within four months by providing security services to international merchant vessels.

title: Worker injured in fire at fireworks workshop in Andiambalama
byline: A 35-year-old worker has been hospitalized following a fire that broke out at a fireworks workshop in Andiambalama, Katunayake.

title: Sri Lanka extend condolences over mass shooting in Canada
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism Vijitha Herath has extended his condolences to the Government and people of Canada over the mass shooting that occurred yesterday in British Columbia.

title: JVP delegation discusses tourism, cultural ties with Kerala Chief Minister
byline: The JVP delegation, led by its General Secretary Tilvin Silva, which is currently in India met Chief Minister of Kerala Pinarayi Vijayan on Wednesday to discuss measures to boost tourism and strengthen cultural ties.

title: US House votes to rescind Trump tariffs on Canada
byline: US House lawmakers voted on Wednesday (Feb 12) to reject Donald Trump’s tariffs on Canadian goods, sweeping aside the president’s last-gasp threat of election consequences for Republicans to deliver a rare rebuke on his signature economic policy.

title: Narcotics, firearm and forged number plates seized following interrogation of female suspect
byline: A stock of narcotics, a firearm and several forged vehicle number plates have been uncovered by officers attached to the Mount Lavinia Police based on information revealed during the interrogation of a detained female suspect.

title: Issuance of passports and visas suspended due to system outage at Dept. of Immigration and Emigration
byline: The issuance of passports and visas have been temporarily suspended due to a technical issue in the system of the Department of Immigration and Emigration, the Department has announced.

title: Police warn of circulation of emails using name of CID Director
byline: It has come to the attention of the authorities that an individual or group is currently circulating a fraudulent email to the general public, falsely claiming to be from the Director of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), Shani Abeysekara, the Police Media Division said in a statement.

title: Indonesia bans elephant rides nationwide after disturbing footage came to light
byline: Indonesia has officially banned elephant rides, bringing an end to the decades-long tourist activity that’s become synonymous with the tropical destination.

title: Bus drivers, conductors arrested while being under the influence of drugs in Piliyandala
byline: A total of seven drivers and conductors employed on private passenger buses have been arrested for operating while under the influence of drugs.

title: SC concludes hearing of FRs against appointment of Deshabandu Tennakoon as IGP
byline: The Supreme Court today (12) concluded the hearing of the Fundamental Rights (FR) petitions filed challenging the appointment of Deshabandu Tennakoon as the Inspector General of Police (IGP) in 2024.

title: Three students injured after boundary wall collapse at Borella school
byline: Three 16-year-old students have sustained injuries when a boundary wall of the C.W.W. Kannangara College in Borella collapsed earlier today (12), police stated.

title: Mamdani calls for 2% tax hike on wealthy New Yorkers
byline: New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani on Wednesday has called for a two percent tax increase for New Yorkers making over a million dollars a year, along with a hike in the state’s corporate tax rate, proposals he originally championed during his campaign.

title: Sri Lanka, Saudi Arabia reaffirm commitment to further enhancing defence cooperation
byline: Sri Lanka and Saudi Arabia have reaffirmed commitment to further enhancing defence cooperation and strengthening bilateral ties between the two countries.

title: ‘Karachi Declaration’ adopted during Sri Lankan Parliamentary delegation’s visit to Pakistan
byline: The ‘Karachi Declaration’ reaffirming shared commitment to democratic governance, parliamentary accountability, inclusivity, responsible innovation and sustainable peace...

title: Issuance of passports and visas suspended due to system outage at Immigration Dept.
byline: The issuance of passports and visas have been temporarily suspended due to a technical issue in the system of the Department of Immigration and Emigration, the Department has announced.

title: Russia sends ‘hundreds’ of missiles, drones at Ukraine
byline: Russia pounded Ukraine with drones and ballistic missiles overnight on Thursday, targeting energy systems and injuring at least seven people in the capital Kyiv, and the cities of Dnipro and Odesa, officials said.

title: Israel has joined Trump’s ‘Board of Peace,’ Netanyahu says
byline: Israel has joined U.S. President Donald Trump’s “Board of Peace” initiative, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday during his visit to Washington where he met Trump and Secretary of State Marco Rubio.

title: Zohara Buhary loses seat in Colombo Municipal Council
byline: Zohara Buhary, who had faced disciplinary action from the Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) for voting in favour of the CMC’s Budget proposal, has lost her seat in the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) after she was removed from the party.

title: Hearing of ‘Sathosa’ case against ex-minister Johnston postponed to March
byline: The Colombo High Court today (12) ordered that further hearing of the case filed against former Minister Johnston Fernando and two others be postponed until March 6, 2026.

title: At least 21 dead after boat sinks on Sudan’s River Nile
byline: At least 21 people have died after a passenger boat sank in River Nile state in northern Sudan, a medical group has told the BBC.

title: CBSL warns against foreign currency transactions between residents in Sri Lanka
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) says it has noticed certain instances where residents in Sri Lanka transact within the country in foreign currency, rather than in Sri Lanka Rupees.

title: Bodies covered in ice as Tangalle Hospital’s mortuary lacks space
byline: The mortuary at the Tangalle Base Hospital is facing a severe space shortage, forcing hospital staff to place the bodies of deceased persons covered in ice on trolleys in the corridor outside the morgue.

title: Sri Lanka Police issues guidelines for lost or stolen mobile phone
byline: Sri Lanka Police has issued a public advisory highlighting the growing number of complaints related to lost, misplaced, and stolen mobile phones reported daily to police stations across the island.

title: Kim Jong Un chooses teen daughter as heir, says Seoul
byline: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has selected his daughter as his heir, South Korea’s spy agency told lawmakers on Thursday.

title: Police urge public cooperation to curb crime, drug trafficking and corruption
byline: Sri Lanka Police say it is currently implementing a nationwide initiative aimed at completely eradicating the growing menace of drug trafficking across the country.

title: Passport applicants requested not to visit Immigration Dept. offices tomorrow
byline: The Ministry of Public Security has requested applicants for passports not to arrive at the Department of Immigration and Emigration’s head office in Battaramulla or any of its regional offices tomorrow (13), as the computer system breakdown has still not been restored.

title: ADB re-affirms long-term support for Sri Lanka in meeting with President
byline: The newly appointed Country Director of the Asian Development Bank (ADB) for Sri Lanka, Ms Shannon Cowlin, paid a courtesy call on President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat this afternoon (12), reaffirming the ADB’s continued commitment to supporting Sri Lanka’s development priorities.

title: Govt. plans to introduce Lanka Metro Transit bus service – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that Sri Lanka’s entire transport system must undergo a rapid transformation to create a more efficient, safe and technologically advanced transport system, thereby providing the public with a dignified and reliable service.

title: Providing equal opportunities to all school children a key objective of govt - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that in order to achieve the transformative change expected as a nation, it is essential to develop strong human resources, and that the Government’s priority is to provide children with a standard and quality education.
